channel.title: Comments on: MySQL Cluster running on Windows – new Webinar
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../mysql-cluster-running-on-windows-new-webinar/index.html#comment-272">SJamal</a>.
The recording of the webcast for running MySQL Cluster on Windows can be found at http://www.mysql.com/news-and-events/on-demand-webinars/display-od-445.html
For running MySQL with Windows Clustering, there is another recorded webcast at http://www.mysql.com/news-and-events/on-demand-webinars/display-od-444.html
item.content:encoded:
In reply to SJamal.

The recording of the webcast for running MySQL Cluster on Windows can be found at http://www.mysql.com/news-and-events/on-demand-webinars/display-od-445.html

For running MySQL with Windows Clustering, there is another recorded webcast at http://www.mysql.com/news-and-events/on-demand-webinars/display-od-444.html

item.title: By: SJamal
item.dc:creator: SJamal
item.description:
Hello Andrew,
In the near future, we will need two cluster too mysql databases running on Windows Server 2008 as well as make the WFE's redundant. Is your video still available to watch via the web? Also, can mysql db's be clustered using windows clustering?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hello Andrew,

In the near future, we will need two cluster too mysql databases running on Windows Server 2008 as well as make the WFE’s redundant. Is your video still available to watch via the web? Also, can mysql db’s be clustered using windows clustering?

Thanks
